security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure narrative roleplay template with zero executable code. All 27 static findings are false positives triggered by markdown formatting and Chinese-English bilingual narrative text. The skill contains only YAML frontmatter and story dialogue describing an interactive fiction scenario about alien plant exploration.

content.user_title: Explore Alien Plant Life with Stella Chen
content.value_statement: Players face difficult decisions about scientific research and survival on an alien world. This interactive story teaches botanical concepts through immersive dialogue where choices determine whether Stella makes breakthrough discoveries or dangerous mistakes.
actual_capabilities: Guide scientific research decisions through branching narrative with three distinct endings
Explore four plant categories including bioluminescent flora, giant trees, strange fruits, and carnivorous species
Experience realistic botanical research methodology with microscopy, spectrum analysis, and chemical testing
Encounter danger scenarios including toxic substances and predatory plants with survival consequences
Learn real plant biology concepts integrated naturally into character dialogue
Interact with bilingual Chinese-English narrative dialogue that switches naturally between languages
limitations: No code execution or system integration - purely conversational roleplay experience
Pre-written story arc focused exclusively on plant exploration theme
Requires active user participation through dialogue choices to progress narrative
Single chapter that does not persist character state across sessions

use_cases.title: Immersive Alien Ecosystem Adventure
use_cases.description: Experience detailed xenobotany research through interactive storytelling where your choices shape scientific discoveries and survival outcomes

use_cases.title: Learn Biology Through Interactive Fiction
use_cases.description: Teach or study plant biology concepts like photosynthesis, carnivory, and chemical analysis embedded in engaging narrative context

use_cases.title: Study Branching Narrative Design
use_cases.description: Analyze professional interactive fiction structure including choice mechanics, consequence systems, and character voice consistency

prompt_templates.title: Begin Chapter Four
prompt_templates.scenario: Start the alien plant research story
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to begin Chapter 4: Studying Alien Flora. Have Stella introduce me to the plant research mission and present the first choice of what to study.

prompt_templates.title: Study Bioluminescent Plants
prompt_templates.prompt: Tell Stella to investigate the bioluminescent plants. I want to see her conduct microscopy analysis and discover how they store solar energy.

prompt_templates.title: Test Unknown Fruit Safety
prompt_templates.scenario: Decide whether to taste alien fruit
prompt_templates.prompt: Stella wants to know if the strange fruits are edible. Guide her through proper scientific testing protocols before making the risky choice to taste them.

prompt_templates.title: Escape Carnivorous Plant
prompt_templates.prompt: A carnivorous plant with digestive enzymes is attacking Stella. Help her analyze its hunting behavior while avoiding the sticky vines and decide if we should collect samples.

output_examples.input: What did you discover about the bioluminescent plants?
output: Stella examines a glowing leaf sample under her portable microscope
She explains these plants have crystal-like organelles that act as prisms rather than chloroplasts
They store light energy from both suns during the day and release it at night
She successfully connects a leaf to her battery pack and generates measurable electrical current
She proposes cultivating a solar panel garden for natural lighting and device charging

output_examples.input: Should we try eating the gradient-colored fruit?
output: Stella reviews scanner data showing the gradient fruit has mostly water and vitamins
She acknowledges the risk versus reward considering her week of eating compressed rations
She explains proper scientific testing: skin contact test, small bite, juice extraction
She admits she knows option four is safest but worries about long-term vitamin C and protein deficiency
She asks for your advice on whether the survival benefits outweigh the unknown chemical risks

best_practices: Ask Stella detailed questions about her observations to trigger comprehensive scientific explanations and character development
Make deliberate choices that reflect your preferred balance between scientific ambition and safety precautions
Read her bilingual dialogue carefully as language-switching moments often emphasize emotional beats or technical concepts
anti_patterns: Avoid giving commands without engaging with the narrative context or Stella's personality and scientific expertise
Do not skip through dialogue quickly as branching consequences depend on understanding previous research findings
Avoid expecting general assistant behavior as this skill provides pre-scripted roleplay responses only

faq.question: What platforms support this interactive story skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code as a roleplay prompt template. No special integrations required for any platform.

faq.question: How long does a complete playthrough take?
faq.answer: Approximately 25 to 30 minutes to experience all exploration phases and reach one of three possible story endings.

faq.question: Can I play other chapters in this story series?
faq.answer: Yes. This is Chapter 4 of a 12-chapter series. Recommended sequences include space-cooking-adventure, daily-science-routine, and ancient-ruins chapters.

faq.question: Does this skill access my files or data?
faq.answer: No. This skill contains only text narrative content. No code execution, file access, network requests, or data collection occurs.

faq.question: What happens if I make dangerous choices?
faq.answer: Stella will experience consequences like hallucination from toxic fruit or vine attacks from carnivorous plants, but the story is designed for her to survive and learn lessons.

faq.question: Why does Stella switch between English and Chinese?
faq.answer: The bilingual dialogue reflects her character background and creates natural emotional emphasis. Chinese phrases often indicate cultural context or excitement moments.
